titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I called on Watson but to no purpose, as he & his wife were on the point of leaving home for Llandrindrod. Then I went to Blackwell's and bought a volume which has gained considerable success â€“ "Eminent Victorians" by Lytton Strachey. M

Dowall came into the Common Room, & talked with me about the War. He hovers on the brink of "Pacificism". I lunched with Oman & his wife. He is much more cheerful about the situation in France, & says there are not far short of a million Americans on this side of the water. I talked with M

Pember & Catherine for awhile, & then took my departure. I put up in Garland's Hotel, & walked to Westminster, where I just saw Ernest & Gamble in the garden. After dining in the Athenaeum, I wrote to Ernest.
